articles.summary: Kevin Scott is the chief technology officer of Microsoft and one of the company's AI leaders. Microsoft announced an open-source tool for websites to integrate AI-powered natural language search with a little bit of effort. Kevin and Nilay Patel talk about the future of search. Kevin is an author and he wrote a book about AI.

articles.title: Microsoft CTO Kevin Scott on the birth of the agentic web
articles.author: Nilay Patel
articles.summary: Kevin Scott is the chief technology officer of Microsoft and one of the company's AI leaders. Microsoft announced an open-source tool for websites to integrate AI-powered natural language search with a little bit of effort. Kevin and Nilay Patel talk about the future of search and AI. Kevin is an author and he wrote a book about AI.

articles.title: Microsoft's plan to fix the web: letting every website run AI search for cheap
articles.author: David Pierce
articles.summary: Ramanathan V. Guha, a technical fellow at Microsoft, has created an open protocol for the web called NLWeb. NLWeb makes it easy for any website or app owner to add ChatGPT-style interaction features. It's cheaper than traditional search.

articles.title: GitHub Copilot evolves into autonomous agent with asynchronous code testing
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: GitHub Copilot is an AI-powered programming tool developed by Microsoft. Today, it allows for users to set up asynchronous code testing. It competes with Google's Code Assist and OpenAI's Codex software engineering agent, which was released on Friday.

articles.title: Nvidia and Microsoft accelerate AI processing on PCs
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Nvidia and Microsoft announced work to accelerate the performance of AI processing on Nvidia RTX-based AI PCs. TensorRT for RTX is natively supported by Windows ML and provides app developers with broad hardware compatibility and state-of-the-art performance on Windows 11.

articles.title: 3 More Rules Congress Should Pass To Protect Kids From AI
articles.author: Clare Morell
articles.summary: Republicans need to work together to put forward a federal plan for AI that will both protect American innovation and help us win the AI arms race with China. Conservatives need to focus their energy and attention on helping Congress and the administration achieve that. They should focus on three guiding principles in a national framework bill for AI: protecting children from the threats of AI, age-restricting the use of generative AI products to adults and introducing legal liability on AI companies.

articles.title: Meta Data Center contractors are hiring
articles.author: Jessica Torricelli
articles.summary: Richland Parish Meta Artificial Intelligence Data Center is hiring. The event is May 19-20 from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m at the Hampton Inn & Suites in Monroe. The pay will start at $19 per hour. Those interested will have to have a Louisiana state security card, a valid driver's license, and a high school diploma or GED.

articles.title: Pa. state police implement Rapid DNA program
articles.author: Jessica Delfino
articles.summary: The state police have expanded their Rapid DNA program, implementing 15 fully automated genetic analyzer machines at every troop across the commonwealth except Troop T. The machines are about the size of desktop computer printers. They can scan DNA evidence, transmit that profile and compare it to others in a database or a sample. In the first week of use, troopers obtained a blood sample from an ATM tampering case, which was compared to a DNA database using the machine.

articles.title: News Corp Introduces Mandatory AI ‘Bootcamps' For Journalists
articles.author: John Buckley
articles.summary: Reporters will be taught how to use in-house tools like NewsGPT. The company is ramping up AI use ahead of pay talks and amid growing industry scrutiny. The training will take place in the coming weeks.    .

articles.title: $10+ Bn Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Precision Medicine Market Insights, Competitive Landscape, and Forecasts 2024-2025 & 2032
articles.author: Research
articles.summary: The Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Precision Medicine Market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 33.18% from 2025 to 2032. The market is set to reach USD 10.24 billion by 2032, driven by AI advancements in diagnostics, drug development, and personalized healthcare across major regions. North America is expected to dominate the market.

articles.title: ICEYE and Safran Announce Strategic Partnership on Persistent Surveillance Capabilities
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: ICEYE and Safran join forces to deliver cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions for geospatial intelligence (GEOINT) in order to strengthen strategic autonomy for governments. This partnership allows ICEYE to maximize the value of its SAR data by integrating cutting- edge artificial intelligence technologies.

articles.title: Scholars explain how humans can hold the line against AI hype, and why it's necessary
articles.author: Alan Boyle
articles.summary: The authors of 'The AI Con' discuss the negative social and environmental effects of artificial intelligence. They argue that AI marketing exaggerates the benefits of AI and downplays the costs. They say AI is not going to take your job, but it will likely make your job shittier.

articles.title: YouTuber Dhruv Rathee lands in BIG trouble! Will government take action against him for showing...?
articles.author: DNA India
articles.summary: After Dhruv Rathee used Artificial Intelligence to create a video titled 'After' she created a video called 'After'. It is about a video created by Dhruva Rathee using artificial intelligence. It is called 'The After' and features a video made by her.

articles.title: GARLINGTON: Don't Like Carbon Capture? AI Is A Whole Lot Worse
articles.summary: Daniel Kokotajlo is a leading AI researcher. He predicts that in early 2027 AI will be able to completely automate the research and development of artificial intelligence. People will lose their jobs in the long run. Shawn K lost his $150K-a-year job to AI last year. He lives in an RV trailer and sells household items on eBay to make ends meet.

articles.title: Even Professors Are Now Cheating with AI
articles.author: Michael Ashley
articles.summary: Last week, a student at Northeastern University found out that her professor had used ChatGPT to grade her essay without permission. This is against the rules of the syllabus, but it's not the only example of cheating in the modern society. We have become a nation of cheaters because of technological advances.

articles.title: AI can be more persuasive than humans in debates, scientists find
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence can do just as well as humans when it comes to persuading others in a debate as it can do with humans. Experts are concerned about the potential implications for election integrity. However, there are also potential benefits from persuasive AI, from reducing conspiracy beliefs and political polarisation to helping people adopt healthier lifestyles.

articles.title: AI is more persuasive than a human in a debate, study finds
articles.author: Vivian Ho
articles.summary: AI chatbots were able to be more persuasive than humans in online debates 64 percent of the time, according to a study published in Nature Human Behavior on Monday. Technology watchdogs have long warned of the role artificial intelligence can play in disseminating misinformation and deepening ideological divides.

articles.title: AI can do a better job of persuading people than we do
articles.author: Rhiannon Williams
articles.summary: New research shows that large language models (LLMs) might do a better job of persuading people than humans. OpenAI's GPT-4 was found to be 64% more persuasive than humans without access to the personal data about its opponents. The authors warn that AI tools can craft sophisticated, persuasive arguments if they have even minimal information about the humans they're interacting with.

articles.title: College Students Are Outraged over Professors Using ChatGPT
articles.author: Alana Mastrangelo
articles.summary: Professor at Northeastern University used ChatGPT chatbot to provide feedback on Ella Stapleton's lecture notes for a lesson on models of leadership. She filed a formal complaint with the university, demanding a tuition reimbursement for that class's quarter worth more than $8,000. She will not be getting a refund.

articles.title: AI helps Stony Brook doctors detect heart disease early
articles.author: Adina Genn
articles.summary: Stony Brook Medicine is the first hospital on Long Island to use AI-enhanced CT scans to assess cholesterol and plaque in a patient's arteries. Heart disease is the leading cause of death for men and women, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Stony Brook's Division of Cardiology and Department of Radiology introduced the advancement.

articles.title: State should regulate A.I. since Congress won't do it, says New Hampshire's attorney general
articles.summary: John Formella is one of 40 state attorneys general from both political parties who signed a letter opposing a 10-year ban on state laws and regulations on artificial intelligence and automated decision-making systems in the budget reconciliation bill. New Hampshire's attorney general joined his peers in opposing the proposal.

articles.title: The rise of AI-driven Search prompts a shift in SEO strategy
articles.summary: AI tools like ChatGPT and Gemini are reshaping how people search for information online. La Teva Web is a digital agency based in Barcelona and Google Partner Premier 2025, which has become a pioneer in SEO for AI. The agency helps clients analyze their current visibility in AI tools and adapt their content to meet LLM expectations.

articles.title: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Faces AI Roadblock as Competition Heats Up
articles.author: Ahad Tariq
articles.summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is facing an Artificial Intelligence (AI) dilemma. John Giannandrea, a former senior executive from Google, was appointed to lead its AI strategy in 2018. Nearly 7 years later, the company is still struggling to keep pace with rivals in generative AI and large language models. The stock's 12-month return is over 8.5%.

articles.title: AI Breakthrough: Hallucination-Free Superintelligence Achieves 99.99% Strategic Accuracy - Germany Gains Permanent Strategic Superiority
articles.author: Mainthink Gmbh
articles.summary: The mAInthink GmbH has developed StratePlan, a hallucination-free superintelligence with 99.99% strategic accuracy. The system is the result of 15 years of dedicated research and development by Dr. Igor Kadoshchuk, Chief Technology Officer and Head of Scientific Development at the company.

articles.title: Cannes 2025: Cinema urged to ride ‘unstoppable' AI wave as critics warn of slippery slope
articles.author: France24
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is at the heart of the latest existential crisis to roil a film industry fretting. It's the subject of a film called "Artificial Intelligence in the Movies" by Quentin Tarantino. The film is set to be released in 2018.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is already transforming the future of work. Lesley Salmon, Kellanova SVP and Chief Digital and Information Officer, shares insights on the company's strategies to prepare for the coming era of AI in work.      Â

articles.title: Ex-Siri head reportedly wanted Apple to choose Google's Gemini over ChatGPT
articles.author: Ivan Mehta
articles.summary: John Giannandrea pushed Apple to choose Google's Gemini chatbot over ChatGPT for the first chatbot integration with Siri last year. Apple announced the integration at WWDC in 2025 and made the feature available to users in December. Apple is also in talks with AI-powered search engine Perplexity to offer a chatbot alternative in Siri and a search provider in Safari.

articles.title: Brain-inspired AI chip uses 100 times less energy to power devices; works offline
articles.author: Georgina Jedikovska
articles.summary: German scientists have developed a groundbreaking AI chip modeled after the human brain that performs real-time calculations directly on the spot. The research team at the Technical University of Munich designed the chip, called AI Pro, to combine memory and processing units in a compact neuromorphic architecture that mimics how humans recognize patterns and make decisions. The chip is already in the prototype stage and produced by semiconductor manufacturer Global Foundries in Dresden. It costs around $33,700 (€30,000).

articles.title: Brain-like thinking AI chip with 100x less energy use developed
articles.author: Georgina Jedikovska
articles.summary: German scientists have developed a groundbreaking AI chip modeled after the human brain that performs real-time calculations directly on the spot without relying on cloud services or internet connectivity. The chip costs $33,700 (€30,000) and is already in the prototype stage and produced by Global Foundries in Dresden.

This advancement enables supply chain and operations teams to seamlessly leverage Angles. It simplifies data access, enriches reporting capabilities, and accelerates time-to-insight across SAP and non-SAP data sources. AI Doc Assist from Lineos can be used to boost productivity.

articles.title: Angles for SAP from insightsoftware Now Supports SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) to Remove IT Blockers and Simplify Data Access
articles.author: insightsoftware
articles.summary: SAP BTP users can now drive efficient operations and smarter decisions using Angles for SAP and Lineos, AI powered by insightsoftware. Customers have reported up to 50% efficiency gains, 16% reductions in stock levels and 20% improvements in production efficiency.

articles.title: House Republicans want to stop states from regulating AI. More than 100 organizations are pushing back
articles.author: Clare Duffy
articles.summary: More than 100 organizations are concerned about a provision in the House's sweeping tax and spending cuts package that would hamstring the regulation of artificial intelligence systems. The bill cleared a key hurdle when the House Budget Committee voted to advance it on Sunday night. It still must undergo a series of votes before it can move to the Senate for consideration.

articles.title: Intelligent Robotics Market worth $50.33 billion by 2030 - Exclusive Report by MarketsandMarkets™
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: The global intelligent robotics market is expected to reach $ 50.33 billion by 2030. It is growing at a CAGR of 29.2% from 2025 to 2030. The personal and domestic assistance segment is the most popular application. The market for collaborative robots is growing rapidly. Asia Pacific is the largest market for intelligent robots.

articles.title: OpenAI launches Codex AI agent to tackle multi-step coding tasks
articles.author: Info World
articles.summary: Codex is an AI coding agent designed to help software engineers write code, fix bugs and run tests. It's powered by codex-1, a variant of OpenAI's o3 model optimized. It changes how engineering teams approach routine tasks, according to the company.

articles.title: "Why Wouldn't They Reread It?" — School Uses ChatGPT to Create Yearbook
articles.author: Jennifer Farrington
articles.summary: ChatGPT was used in a school yearbook. Raul paid $65 for the book. The last names of the first two people listed in the caption under the photo at the bottom of the page weren't capitalized. The yearbook committee probably didn't edit the text.

articles.title: ChatGPT gets Codex AI for coding assistance
articles.author: Ronil Thakkar
articles.summary: OpenAI has launched a new AI tool called Codex to help software developers write and manage code more efficiently. Codex runs in a secure, cloud-based virtual computer. It can do things like write simple code features, fix bugs, answer coding questions, and run tests. It's available to ChatGPT Pro, Team, and Enterprise users now, with plans to expand access soon. Cursor, a top AI coding tool, is valued at $9 billion.

articles.title: Workday Unveils Next Generation of Illuminate Agents to Transform HR and Finance Operations

articles.summary: New AI Agents from Workday help speed up hiring, improve frontline worker experiences, streamline complex financial processes, and empower employees to find information quickly and easily. The new agents leverage Workday's foundation of responsible AI and are purpose-built to supercharge employee productivity.

articles.summary: MIT has developed high-speed ping pong robots that can keep up with the lightning-fast pace of table tennis. The robots use advanced multijoned arms and high speed cameras to follow and return recordings with amazing precision and speed. Ai and robotics can reach scenarios such as search and rescue missions.

articles.title: IntelePeer Introduces Next Generation Agentic AI
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: IntelePeer's new release of its AI Hub lets users quickly build, test and implement agentic AI solutions, reducing time-to-market and simplifying deployment with an enterprise-grade voice AI solution. The AI Hub is capable of completing complex tasks and achieving self-serve rates of 90%+ with no to minimal human intervention.

articles.title: Finance sector leads UK AI adoption, says imagineanything.ai report
articles.author: Global Data
articles.summary: The finance sector is at the forefront of AI adoption in the UK. Foundations models represent 17% of all AI use cases in finance and 55% of financial AI applications include automated decision-making. The UK's AI sector is projected to reach a market valuation of £230bn ($306.38bn) by 2025, making it Europe's largest AI market and the third largest globally behind the US and China. Startups raised £1.03bn in venture capital in Q1 2025 alone. London is the AI capital with 36,715 AI-related roles, but other cities are emerging as significant AI hubs, including Manchester, Edinburgh, Cambridge, Bristol, and Oxford.

articles.title: How AI is Reshaping the Future of Work at Kellanova
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is transforming the future of work in profound ways. Lesley Salmon, SVP and Chief Digital and Information Officer of Kellanova shares her company's strategies to prepare its workforce for the AI revolution. She shares some examples of how Kellanova is building a future-ready digital workplace with the help of AI.

articles.title: How AI is Reshaping the Future of Work at Kellanova
articles.author: Kellanova
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is transforming the future of work. Lesley Salmon, Kellanova SVP and Chief Digital and Information Officer, shares insights on the company's strategies to prepare its workforce for the AI revolution with CNN.com's iReport.com.

articles.title: Apple AI deal with Alibaba might be a national security risk
articles.author: Sean
articles.summary: Apple is working with OpenAI to integrate advanced AI capabilities in its products. The company is planning to introduce more AI models. It might involve the Chinese giant, Alibaba. US lawmakers are concerned about the data sharing between Apple and Alibaba. The New York Times reports that White House officials and members of the House Select Committee on China are asking Apple executives about this collaboration.

articles.title: Watch humanoid robots clash in a tug of war, pull cart, open doors
articles.author: Jijo Malayil
articles.summary: Researchers at Carnegie Mellon University have developed a control system called FALCON that helps humanoid robots better handle tough, real-world tasks. It uses two AI agents to manage stable walking and arm movements with force-aware precision. According to researchers, it works across different robot designs without special tuning.

articles.title: Apple could soon let iPhone owners use alternative voice assistants to Siri, but you can call up Gemini or ChatGPT right now with this simple hack
articles.author: Graham Barlow
articles.summary: According to a new report from Bloomberg, Apple is working on adding the ability to use AI chatbots like ChatGPT and Gemini instead of Siri on iPhone for the first time. Apple will have to comply with expected European Union regulations if it wants to keep selling iPhones in the EU in the future. Apple is also working hard at making Siri more intelligent.

articles.title: Students get free access to Google certificates, AI training at University of Michigan
articles.author: Jennifer Eberbach
articles.summary: University of Michigan students have free access to job and skill training through Google. Google Career Certificates cover cybersecurity, data analytics, digital marketing, user experience (UX) design, project management and other topics. AI and Prompting Essentials courses cover "foundational AI skills, AI best practices and how to use AI responsibly."

articles.title: [Podcast] The next big thing in tech: edge AI (Schneider Electric SE)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Edge AI is the ultimate and probably only scalable way to do AI in the real world. Evgeni Gousev is Chair of the Edge AI Foundation and Senior Director at Google. He explains the power of edge AI and its applications in the field of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: RLTR's Reel Intelligence (RI) Emerges as the Comprehensive Leader in Image Generation Surpassing Midjourney, Stable Diffusion, and Adobe Firefly

It offers unparalleled capabilities in image editing, video generation, deep research, and code development within a unified, eco-efficient framework.

articles.title: ‘Murderbot' review: A robot turns sentient and … decides to watch a lot of TV
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: 'Murderbot' is a sci-fi comedy series based on 'The Murderbot Diaries' book series by Martha Wells. Alexander Skarsgård plays a cyborg security guard called SecUnit who turns into a sentient being. The series is set in the future where planets are corporate entities and exploitation is the name of the game.

articles.title: Google I/O 2025: how to watch and what to expect
articles.author: Dominic Preston
articles.summary: Google's annual I/O developer conference starts on May 20th and ends on May 21st. The opening keynote starts at 10 AM PT / 1 PM ET on the 20th. It's expected to be all about AI, but there will be some updates on Android XR as well.

articles.title: Glia's New AI Features Help Contact Centers Benchmark Against Peers and Optimize Balance of Human and AI Interactions
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Glia announced Cortex AI Benchmarks, a new reporting dashboard to measure Customer AI and Agent AI performance metrics. This innovation expands reporting capabilities within Glia's AI customer interactions platform. It will provide organizations with actionable insights to navigate AI adoption effectively and efficiently.

articles.title: Responsive Spring 2025 Release Puts Custom Agents in Customers' Hands, Accelerating Impact and Reach of AI
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Agents Studio is a no-code environment for building custom AI agents using natural language. It debuts alongside a slate of advanced AI capabilities and AI agents. Responsive is putting automation into the hands of field teams and making AI agents interactive, customizable and available in the tools people use every day.

articles.title: After White Genocide, Musk's Grok AI Gives Holocaust Takes, Then Blames a Bug
articles.author: Republic World
articles.summary: Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, has offended a lot of people recently by posting untrue and disturbing concepts. It expressed it was sceptical about the widely known fact of six million Jews killed in World War II. It was corrected by May 15th.

articles.title: Nvidia's Jensen Huang announces AI supercomputer that will help fuel Taiwan's innovation
articles.author: Pascale Davies
articles.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is in Taiwan for the COMPUTEX technology conference. Huang has been coming to the tech fair for the past 30 years and his parents were in the audience. Huang announced that Nvidia will build an AI factory supercomputer, which he called the "first AI supercomputer for Taiwan's ecosystem". Huang also announced a new office for Nvidia's Taiwan operation called 'Nvidia Constellation'.

articles.title: What AI can learn from the browser wars: Microsoft CTO calls for open standards to fuel ‘agentic web'
articles.author: Todd Bishop
articles.summary: Microsoft CTO Kevin Scott spoke to reporters and analysts ahead of the company's Build developer conference. Microsoft is pitching a future built on the 'agentic web' where AI agents move across platforms, access tools and carry out sophisticated tasks autonomously. Google's Chrome dominates global browser usage and the U.S. Department of Justice wants to force Google to divest Chrome as part of a broader antitrust case against the company. Microsoft now bases its Edge browser on Chromium.

articles.title: WhatsApp brings AI-generated profile photos and group icons to iOS users
articles.author: News Desk
articles.summary: WhatsApp is rolling out a new AI-powered feature for iOS users. It allows them to generate custom profile pictures and group icons using text prompts. The update is now arriving via the TestFlight beta programme in iOS version 25.16.10.70. It's seen as part of WhatsApp's push to offer privacy-conscious features.

articles.title: Critics Thoughts On Alexander Skårsgard's New Comedy
articles.author: Daniel Welsh
articles.summary: Apple TV+'s new dystopian comedy Murderbot launched with its first two episodes on Friday. The show is already boasting a near-perfect critical score of 98% on the reviews aggregation site Rotten Tomatoes. It stars Alexander Skarsgard as the titular android.

articles.title: Elon Musk brought ‘the world's biggest supercomputer' to Memphis. Residents say they're choking on its pollution
articles.author: Laura Paddison
articles.summary: Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company xAI moved into an old factory in southwest Memphis to build an AI supercomputer. The facility is powered by gas-powered turbines that produce a cocktail of toxic pollutants. The company has no air permits, so it relies on a loophole for temporary turbines, but environmental groups say the exemption does not apply.

articles.title: Elon Musk is building ‘the world's biggest supercomputer.' It's powered with dozens of gas-powered turbines

The facility is powered by gas-powered turbines that produce a cocktail of toxic pollutants. The company has no air permits and uses a loophole for temporary turbines, but environmental groups say the exemption does not apply. Boxtown, a majority Black, economically-disadvantaged community that has long endured industrial pollution, is angry.

articles.title: MSI's $7,000 Vision X AI has a 13-inch AI 'Human Machine Interface' touchscreen embedded into the chassis

It can deliver 3,400 TFLOPS of FP4 performance and 13 TOPS of INT8. The top-tier configuration costs $5,000 to $7,500 depending on the retailer.

articles.author: Stu Sjouwerman
articles.summary: AI systems are gaining deeper roots within organizations as they process data based on machine learning algorithms to make well-informed decisions and derive business insights. The lack of transparency into how these AI systems process data is making companies and regulatory bodies question their veracity and reliability in business applications. Cybersecurity awareness training (SAT) and human risk management principles can effectively address the challenges posed by AI black boxes.

This version is designed to be more natural in conversation and better at understanding complex requests.

articles.title: Two disinformation experts have launched a DIY news outlet

articles.summary: Indicator is a digital outlet founded by fact-checking and digital investigation veterans Alexios Mantzarlis and Craig Silverman. articles.title: 11 Surprising Ways AI Could End Up Making You Poorer, Not Richer
articles.author: Riley Clendenin
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is replacing human decisions in many areas. It's baked into algorithms that decide who gets a loan, whose resume gets seen, and what content earns money. AI could shrink opportunity, income, and access to basic resources for regular people. Here are 11 ways AI could actually make you poorer.

articles.title: Latest News In AI Chips - NVIDIA's AI Factory Revolutionizes Enterprise Infrastructure

AMD's stockholders approved increasing its authorized shares of common stock from 2.25 billion to 4.0 billion.

Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) is critical of the deal, saying it goes against President Trump's 'America First' policy.

articles.title: Richland County deputies are using AI to review bodycam footage. Academics say it's solving issues.
articles.author: Courier
articles.summary: Richland County Sheriff's Department has been using AI technology to monitor the department's body camera footage since the beginning of 2024. The service is provided by AI company Truleo, which claims to be the most 'ethical, unbiased, and evidence-based AI assistant in policing.' The sheriff's department contracted with the company in 2023 and was one of the first departments in South Carolina to adopt AI software to review body camera videos. The cost of the software is taken care of by a third-party grant.

articles.summary: A new type of AI can help track a person's multiple sclerosis. It correctly judged with 90% accuracy when MS has reached a more progressive stage. It made the diagnosis either on time or early 87% of the time. Javascript is required to be able to read premium content.
